Description: Ostracon, large fragment of the body of a pale-red pottery convex vessel, the interior is covered with a cream-coloured deposit, the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured slip and very faint traces of a number of lines of Coptic text written in black ink. A receipt for corn.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.208)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36353) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36353)
